pages.text: Sub-species to Enderman, these odd creatures are far more sustainable to being bound to their summoner than their nigh impossible to control cousin.

All Enderlings are capable of teleportation, but unlike the Enderman, they don't teleport as often and some of them would disappear from combat for a couple of seconds to confuse their foes. They are also vulnerable to water.
Unfortunately, the book is incapable of showing their eyes properly for some arcane reason.

Watchling Servants are simple brutes that attack by teleporting in front of their enemy and swinging their arms at them. They can either be summoned through a ritual or casting with a $(l:focuses/void/watching_focus)Watching Focus$().

Blastling Servants are the toughest enderling health-wise, and attack by shooting a volley of hot goo at their enemies, though they would temporarily run or teleport away if a foe gets close to them. They can either be summoned through a ritual or casting with a $(l:focuses/void/blasting_focus)Blasting Focus$().

Snareling Servants are odd yet devious. They would first attempt at shooting their Snareling Goop at their foe, which would ensnare them for a time when hit, then they would either teleport or run towards their foe and attack them with their arms. They would temporarily try to run or teleport away if a foe gets close to them, if they're not ensnared. They can either be summoned through a ritual or casting with a $(l:focuses/void/snaring_focus)Snaring Focus$().
They can be healed by feeding them Chorus Fruits or wearing $(l:crafts/garment/void_robe)Void Robes with soul energy$().
